author: Paul Hannon
title: Italy Crisis Highlights Need for Urgent Eurozone Reform, Says OECD
text:
A jump in Italyâ€™s borrowing costs in response to the political crisis unfolding in Rome is a wake-up call for eurozone governments that have been dragging their feet over economic reforms, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said Wednesday.
In its quarterly assessment of the economic outlook, the research body also said governments have taken over from central banks as the chief providers of economic stimulus, but some risk overheating their economies, leading to higher inflation and interest rates.
